column1: D.Diogo Lopes de Sequeira (1465–1530) was a Portuguese fidalgo
column2: sent to analyze the trade potential in Madagascar and Malacca
column3: he arrived at Malacca on 11 September 1509. He left the next year when he discovered that Sultan Mahmud Shah was planning his assassination. This gave Afonso de Albuquerque the opportunity to embark upon his expedition of conquests.

column1: Sequeira was subsequently made governor of Portuguese India (1518–1522)
column2: and in 1520 led a military campaign into the Red Sea which hastened the first legitimate Portuguese embassy to Ethiopia.

column3: "Diogo Lopes de Sequeira: Elements on His Office of Almotacé Mor"
